text:
When the page contains more than about 50 tags (your mileage may vary), the compiler seems to get confused and complain "Variable _jspx_eval_show_bug_51 may not have been initialized" for each subsequent occurrence of a tag. The same generated class compiles w/o a problem from the command line (using sun javac v. 1.4.0_01). This has nothing to do with the 64K limit on method size, as the .class file created with 50 tags (no bug) is 12k. To replicate, use the following: taglib class (Bug.java): package bug; import javax.servlet.jsp.*; import javax.servlet.jsp.tagext.*; public class Bug extends TagSupport{} tld file (bug.tld): 1.0 1.1 bug a demo of the bug bug bug.Bug empty jsp file: <%@ taglib uri="/WEB-INF/bug.tld" prefix="show" %> (If bug doesn't show, add more lines like the ones these:) here's a tag:

This bug is comes from a deprecated version of javac, sun.tools.javac.Main, that
is being used in TC4.0.x.  Javac got confused when there are too many local
variables.

TC4.1.x, which uses jasper2, which uses ant for javac compilation, allows
J2sdk1.4 javac to be used, does not have this problem
